title: If you were to re-size an atom to a size which us humans can see, what would an atom look like? - Quora

response.answer_text: It would probably look like a blur. The difficulty in answering this question is that we are only able to see anything because of the way atoms reflect, absorb, and emit photons. If you made an atom a hundred thousand times larger, it wouldn’t be an atom anymore. It wouldn’t be able to interact with normal photons the way it should, so all best are off as to how, if at all, it would affect light. It might just be a dark smudge of nothing. But ignoring all that, assuming it interacts with photons like normal, it would look like a fuzzy, wavy ball. You would only be able to see the outer electron shell, and it would look like a wiggly three dimensional standing wave wrapped into a ball. Everything beneath it would be hidden.
